events.title: First Telegraph Message Sent by Samuel Morse
events.description: Samuel Morse sent the first long-distance telegraph message, 'What hath God wrought,' from Washington, D.C. to Baltimore, marking the beginning of telecommunications.
events.significance: This event revolutionized communication, enabling instant transmission of information and laying the foundation for modern telecommunications.

events.title: Opening of the Brooklyn Bridge
events.description: The Brooklyn Bridge was officially opened in New York City, connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn over the East River.
events.significance: At the time, it was the longest suspension bridge in the world and an iconic engineering achievement symbolizing urban development.

events.title: Railway Workers' Strike Begins in the UK
events.description: A nationwide railway strike began in the United Kingdom, impacting transportation and economy.
events.significance: The strike highlighted the power of unions and the tensions between labor and government during post-war Britain.

events.title: Discovery of Exoplanet 51 Pegasi b Announced
events.description: Astronomers officially announced the discovery of 51 Pegasi b, the first confirmed exoplanet orbiting a Sun-like star.
events.significance: This milestone opened a new era in astronomy, expanding our understanding of planetary systems beyond our own.
